title: FHWA-NHI-137050: ITS What, Why, and How
description: This training equips professionals responsible for ITS programs with an understanding of ITS capabilities, planning and procurement processes, operations management, and workforce needs for long-term success.

title: FHWA-NHI-137049: ITS Procurement
description: This training provides an overview of strategies for successfully deploying ITS projects that build on systems engineering principles and practices. It is focused on the procurement stage of the procurement stage of the acquisition process from identifying needs through contractor selection.

title: ARC-IT Training
description: This training provides an overview of the Architecture Reference for Cooperative & Intelligent Transportation (ARC-IT) including background, structure, and use of the architecture.

title: RAD-IT Training
description: This training provides an overview of the Regional Architecture Development Tool for Intelligent Transportation (RAD-IT) - an interactive software program that assists transportation planners and system integrators in the development of regional and project architectures.

title: SET-IT Training
description: This training provides an overview of the Systems Engineering Tool for Intelligent Transportation (SET-IT) - an interactive software program that assists transportation project developers and system integrators in the development of project architectures.

title: ITS Architecture Use & Maintenance Training
description: This training prepare ITS professionals to effectively use and maintain their regional ITS architecture. Participants should have a copy of their regional ITS architecture to use to complete the exercises.

title: On-Site Trainings and Workshops
description: U.S. DOT offers on-site, facilitated courses and workshops on several topic areas

title: FHWA-NHI-137051: Systems Engineering Fundamentals for ITS
description: "Systems Engineering Fundamentals" is an 8-hour NHI course introducing ITS project staff to key systems engineering concepts and best practices like modeling, testing, and risk assessment.

title: Foundational Systems Engineering Activities to Support ITS Procurement
description: This training guides transportation professionals in applying systems engineering to advance ITS project development with a focus on planning and needs-based scoping.

title: Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) Training
description: Participants are introduced to the key components that enable a V2X ecosystem, the potential benefits of the technology, and example use cases and the messages and standards supporting them while ensuring safety and privacy.

title: FHWA-NHI-133128: Making the Business Case for Institutional, Organizational, and Procedural Changes for TSMO
description: This 1-hour course is designed to is designed to help practitioners from state and local agencies make a business case for transportation systems management & operations (TSMO).

title: FHWA-NHI-133131: Planning for TSMO - Introduction
description: This training focuses on integrating TSMO into planning, covering performance-driven approaches, collaboration methods, and institutionalization strategies.

title: FHWA-NHI-133132: Planning for TSMO - Concepts and Applications
description: This training builds on Course 1 (NHI-133131 Planning for TSMO) and covers integrating TSMO into transportation planning and implementing an objectives-driven performance-based approach.

title: FHWA-NHI-133133: Planning for TSMO - Putting Concepts into Action
description: This web conference training session builds on Course 2 (NHI-133132) and uses interactive activities to engage participants and bring the concepts of planning for TSMO to life.

title: Crowdsourcing for Operations Course as a Webinar Series
description: The "Crowdsourcing for Advancing Operations" webinar series provides insights from practitioners on using crowdsourced data to improve transportation operations.

title: FHWA-NHI-137072: Weather Responsive Traffic Management (WRTM)
description: This training provides information about basic principles and tools to help transportation system managers and operators effectively manage traffic flow and operations during adverse weather conditions.

title: FHWA-NHI-137073: Principles and Tools for Road Weather Management
description: This training provides transportation professionals in highway maintenance and/or highway operations with training to develop tools and strategies for addressing road weather problems.

title: FHWA-NHI-137074: Road Weather Information Systems (RWIS) Equipment and Operations
description: This training provides an overview of road weather information Systems (RWIS) and explores exercises to help participants develop action plans to addressing their road weather challenges.

title: FHWA-NHI-133126A: National Traffic Incident Management Responder Training
description: This training covers Traffic Incident Management (TIM) recommended procedures and techniques, including: TIM Fundamentals and Terminology, Notification and Scene Size-Up, Safe Vehicle Positioning, Scene Safety,  Command Responsibilities, Traffic Management, Special Circumstances, and  Clearance and Termination.

title: FHWA-NHI-137055: Transportation Cyber Security
description: This training is intended to help transportation professionals improve their understanding of transportation cyber security and offers the tools that are useful for learning more about cyber security and resilience.

title: Standards Trainings
description: The 64-module training series is for practitioners in state and local highway agencies and transit agencies who seek the skills needed to procure, test, implement, and operate standards-based ITS systems and devices. Consultants, system designers, integrators, and testers will also find the training informative.

title: Transit Standards Trainings
description: The 25-module transit training series focuses exclusively on standards used in transit applications. Similar to the 64-modules series, the transit modules give practitioners the skills to help them effectively procure and utilize standards used in transit systems and devices.
